text: The Lord told me, “Go again and love a woman3:1. “A woman”—understood to be Gomer from what follows. It may be that Gomer is not specifically identified since she cannot claim to be Hosea's wife because of her adultery. who is loved by another and who is committing adultery, just as the Lord loves the children of Israel, even though they turn to other gods and love their sensual worship.”3:1. Literally “raisin cakes”—part of the pagan worship rituals.
